Title: Temporal geometry constraint
Explanation: This field equation imposes a constraint on the temporal geometry, specifying that it remains unaffected by the Riemann curvature tensor $K$.
Riemann’s curvature tensor of the affine connection is zero. Found as $K=0$ in Friedman. It is one of Trautman’s homogenous condition.
Covariant derivative of $dt$ equals zero to ensure the simultaneity slices are flat.
Condition that preserves angles and distances when parallel transporting along a curve.
Covariant derivative of h describes euclidean geometry.
Covariant derivative of V equals zero. It makes the lines in the rigging of space-time to be geodesics.

Title: $dt(V)=1$
Explanation: Derivative of $V=0$ makes the lines in the rigging of space-time to be timelike.
An orthogonality condition that describes euclidean geometry.

Title: Non metricity tensor vanishes
Explanation: Homogeneous Trautman condition.

Title: Cartan torsion tensor vanishes
Explanation: Homogeneous Trautman Condition $\widetilde{R}_{bd}^{ac}=\widetilde{R}_{db}^{ca}$.

Title: $\Gamma$: Affine connection
Explanation: A generalised connection for vector fields in curved spaces where torsion and non-metricity are not necessarily zero, telling us about straitest curve.

Title: $dt$: Time function
Explanation: Co-vector that induces a foliation of $M$ into three-dimensional hyper surfaces.

Title: $\eta$: Minkowski’s metric
Explanation: Flat non-dynamical metric. Since $Riem(\gamma)=0$, we can always choose global coordinates in which $\eta_{\mu\nu}=diag(-1,1,1,1)$.

Title: $\overline{\nabla}$: Flat connection
Explanation: A derivative for flat spaces.

Title: $h$: Flat Metric tensor
Explanation: A symmetric tensor field of type $(2,0)$. h is defined on de cotangent space $T_{p}^{*}\times T_{p}^{*}$ and has signature $<3,0,1>$. It induces a three-dimensional metric on each hypersurface.

Title: $\Gamma*$: Metric-Affine connection
Explanation: A connection for Metric-affine spaces where non-metricity and torsion are not zero.

Title: $\left\{ _{\mu\nu}^{\lambda}\right\} $: Metric connection
Explanation: Also called Levi-Civita connection, it is dependent on the metric $g$. It gives us information about how to transport vectors along a curve, while conserving the metric.

Title: $g_{\mu\nu}$: Metric tensor
Explanation: A symmetric tensor field of type $(0,2)$ and signature $<1,3>$. Provides a sense of distance and angles between vectors telling us about shortest curve.

Title: $\nabla$: Newton-Cartan Connection
Explanation: Non-flat covariant connection. In Friedman it is found as $D$.

Title: Non metricity tensor
Explanation: It measures the failure of the connection to covariantly conserve the metric.

Title: $V$: Contra vector field
Explanation: Describes absolute space. $T_{\sigma}=V$ along $\sigma$.

Title: M: Differentiable manifold
Explanation: A topological space that resembles euclidean space near each point. It can be coordinatized by Rn through a family of homeomorphisms.

Title: Signature for the metric tensor
Explanation: The signature contains one positive and three negative index. There are GR models with different signatures.

Title: Signature
Explanation: Signature for the metric tensor is definite-positive.

Title: Dependency
Explanation: The connection $\Gamma_{\mu\nu}^{\lambda}$  and the metric tensor $g_{\mu\nu}$  depend on each other.

Title: Independency between variables
Explanation: The connection $\Gamma_{\mu\nu}^{\lambda}$ may be expressed independently of the metric tensor $g_{\mu\nu}$.

Title: Dimension: $N=4$
Explanation: The dimension of a vector space is the cardinality of a base of $M$.

Title: Signature
Explanation: for the metric tensor: Not-definite-positive $<-,+,+,+>$ or $<+,-,-,->$.
